dismissalText.commentary: Afif Hossain c Bavuma b Rabada 72 (107b 9x4 0x6 130m) SR: 67.28

dismissalComment.html: taken by Bavuma at short midwicket! A very good knock from Afif comes to an end. He had little option other than trying to go for the big hits with only five overs to go. He ends up slicing that back of a length ball outside off and skies that to the man, and that hard length from Rabada pays off as he bowls with a scrambled seam too

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz c Malan b Rabada 38 (49b 1x4 2x6 75m) SR: 77.55

dismissalComment.html: five for Rabada! This time Malan holds on at mid-off, and this turns out to be Rabada's fifth wicket. Malan dives forward and across to his left, and takes that low. Looked like the ball came slower off the pitch that Mehidy expected, almost as if it got stuck. Mehidy went for the loft over mid-off, but ended up chipping it while almost checking his shot last moment. Rabada has two in the over, and Bangladesh in danger of getting bowled out soon

dismissalComment.html: Bangladesh slide further! Short delivery aimed at the chest. Litton has showed in this innings that he won't shy away from playing the upper cut, but with the ball too close to cut he decides to pull away from the stroke at the last moment and the ball takes the edge and flies to the keeper. Not quite a periscope, but poor nonetheless

dismissalComment.html: short delivery get the wicket! It was short and angled in. Yasir looks get his bottom hand off the handle as he is looking away. It takes the leading edge and flies to Keshav Maharaj at backward point. Superb bowling by Rabada in this spell

dismissalComment.html: extra bounce does it for Ngidi! Tamim is coming forward and the bounce catches him unaware as he prods at it and gets an edge that bobs up after hitting the thumb. The fielder at backward point runs in and takes the catch. Good start for South Africa

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Malan b Shamsi 25 (44b 3x4 0x6 62m) SR: 56.81

dismissalComment.html: gone, tucked to leg slip! The ball turning into the right-hander means that it was a matter of time before that fielder came to play. Full and tossed up ball on middle and leg, with a hint of turn into the batter. Mahmudullah closes the bat face to run that down behind the wicket, but ends up gifting it low to Malan stationed close in. Shamsi gets his first, as the spinners get off the mark

dismissalText.commentary: Shoriful Islam c sub (AK Markram) b van der Dussen 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: taken at long-on! VDD wears the smile of a hero. Substitute fielder Markram is placed on the long-on fence, and he doesn't have to move to catch that. The ball was fullish on middle, and right in the slot for Shoriful to have a slog at that. He swings across the line after getting his front leg out of the way, but finds the fielder

dismissalText.long: c Afif Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Afif Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 62 (41b 9x4 2x6 70m) SR: 151.21

dismissalComment.html: brilliant catch at deep midwicket! Afif with a repeat of the catch Tamim took in the first ODI. What else can Afif do for his side today? Right on the edge of the rope, he has to leap a little to his left, and he times his jump perfectly. He grabs the ball, but realising that he is falling over to the other side of rope, he throws it back with his right hand. He goes outside the boundary line then comes back in again, but keeps his eyes on the ball throughout. And once he is back in, it becomes a simple catch. commentTextItems.html: comes forward and drives it past cover for a boundary. That seals the win for South Africa

commentPostTextItems.html: Thanks for joining us today and keeping it lively with the feedback. Do join us on Wednesday for the series decider. Keep an eye out for Isam's report and the match piece. Till then it's a good night from me, Himanshu and Chandan

Bavuma: My finger is a bit sore and I need to go for a scan. Resilience is a big thing for us. Saying that, we need to begin a series well and it's not good to begin it with a match down. From a resilience point of view, I will take it. The guys sort of convinced me to bowl. Fortunately, the bowlers upfront did a good job and we were not put under pressure. The new ball could've been tough but Quinny (de Kock) saw it differently. These conditions are different from Centurion, which is a lot truer. We will take forward the confidence and momemtum from this game into the final game

Rabada is the Player of the match: After the first wicket where it hit a crack and reared up we felt we were in. In the recent past, Wanderers has given extra bounce with the new ball and not much thereafter but there was variable bounce today. With the ball gripping, our seamers did well to utilize it. You try to keep it as simple as possible. We can't just go all out aggressive and it's important to rely on your tactics. To rely on them and execute it is what we see as aggression and not bowling short

Tamim Iqbal: the wicket was not what we expected. Pace and bounce we can take it, but uneven you can't. We can make a lot of comments about winning toss and bat/bowl. I think we can't write off this game. We made mistakes and they bowled well. In the middle overs, we could've scored more and hurt them. At one stage, 100 was looking difficult but we made 194. At the end of the day, we can blame a lot of things but we played poorly. Sometimes things don't go your way.
In hindsight, Bangladesh would've been better off bowling rather than batting after winning the toss. It's all to play for in the final ODI of the series on Wednesday which will be a day-night match.

The assault by de Kock on bowlers in the Powerplay left the Bangladesh bowlers flat. South Africa bowlers were happy to exploit the bounce aided by the pitch and they had the top order of Bangladesh in all sorts of trouble. The same can't be said of the Bangladesh bowlers as they seemed to be unsure of the lengths to bowl in the early stages of South Africa innings

dismissalText.long: c Afif Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Afif Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 62 (41b 9x4 2x6 70m) SR: 151.21

dismissalComment.html: brilliant catch at deep midwicket! Afif with a repeat of the catch Tamim took in the first ODI. What else can Afif do for his side today? Right on the edge of the rope, he has to leap a little to his left, and he times his jump perfectly. He grabs the ball, but realising that he is falling over to the other side of rope, he throws it back with his right hand. He goes outside the boundary line then comes back in again, but keeps his eyes on the ball throughout. And once he is back in, it becomes a simple catch. It was a full ball on middle and off, and de Kock went down on his back knee to slog-sweep. It was timed well and also made a sweet sound off the bat, but for Afif's intervention

dismissalComment.html: brilliant catch at deep midwicket! Afif with a repeat of the catch Tamim took in the first ODI. What else can Afif do for his side today? Right on the edge of the rope, he has to leap a little to his left, and he times his jump perfectly. He grabs the ball, but realising that he is falling over to the other side of rope, he throws it back with his right hand. He goes outside the boundary line then comes back in again, but keeps his eyes on the ball throughout. And once he is back in, it becomes a simple catch. It was a full ball on middle and off, and de Kock went down on his back knee to slog-sweep. It was timed well and also made a sweet sound off the bat, but for Afif's intervention
